Shrink geometry component of a BirdFlow object

Source: R/shrink_birdflow.R
shrink_geom.Rd

This is an internal helper function called twice by shrink_birdflow() it adjusts the nrow, ncol, ext, and mask elements of the geom component of a BirdFlow model to the original extent, while preserving the same number, location, and alignment of the unmasked cells - thus nothing else in the object needs to change. If the geometry has not be extended (shrink_birdflow(), extend_geom()) then it is returned as is.

Usage

shrink_geom(geom)

Arguments

geom

The geometry component of a BirdFlow object

Value

shrunk (or original) geometry
